title: AB 2676
content: Section 17052.6 of the Revenue and Taxation Code in California is amended to allow a credit against the "net tax" for expenses related to household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit amount is determined based on the Internal Revenue Code, with a percentage determined for taxable years before January 1, 2003. The adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment in California. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets, with higher incomes receiving lower or no credit. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services in California. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets: $40,000 or less - 65%, over $40,000 but not over $70,000 - 50%, over $70,000 but not over $100,000 - 34%, over $100,000 - 0%. For taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2019. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services in California. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets: $40,000 or less - 50%, over $40,000 but not over $70,000 - 43%, over $70,000 but not over $100,000 - 34%, over $100,000 - 0%. The credit is limited to expenses for household services and care provided in the state. Earned income for active services in the Armed Forces is considered taxable income in California. The definition of a qualifying individual for the household and dependent care credit is expanded to include children as defined in the Internal Revenue Code. For tax purposes, a child shall be treated as receiving over one-half of their support from the parent with custody for a greater portion of the year, who is then considered the "custodial parent." This classification allows the child to be considered a qualifying individual for tax benefits. The child must receive over half of their support from parents who never married and lived apart during the last six months of the year. The child must also be in the custody of one or both parents for more than half of the year. The amendments to this section apply to taxable years starting in 2002 and 2011. This act provides for a tax levy and takes immediate effect.
